text: In the white winter,\\nfrosty winds chill the bone;\\nThe Earth stands hard as iron,\\nand water like a stone.
Sumer is icumen in,\\nLhude sing cuccu!\\nGroweþ sed and bloweþ med\\nAnd springþ þe wde nu,\\nSing cuccu!
The summer is finally over,\\nand all the summer flowers;\\nThe harvest fire blazes,\\nsurrounded by golden towers
Give us pleasure in the flowers today\\ngive us pleasure in the orchard white.\\nFragrant fruits by day,\\nchittering insects by night
My home is starred with frost;\\nThe world is bitter cold tonight;\\nThe moon is cruel, and the wind;\\nIs like a two-edged sword to smite.
The searing heat of the hot summer sun shines down unforgivingly upon the baked earth. Pervading stillness hangs like a heavy veil around us.
On a day like today,\\nplease take me away,\\nfrom the cold and windy weather.
A waste of waters ruthlessly sways and uplifts its weedy mane;\\nWhere brooding day stares down upon the sea in dull disdain.
The Thaw: %+n% movement speed on the first turn of spring
Though the Danes may find this country mild, the cold still bites. We would be wise to prepare for winter.
